title: jerry0
author: jerry0
content: At the moment, I'm still using the older version of ledger live 2.42.0.  Reason being a while back people said the next update or update after that had issues with the balance not being correct so I didn't do any updates etc.  I did however do transactions with it though.Now each time that I am ready to do the ledger live update on the top right corner, it seem like every few day later, there is always a newer ledger live update.  For me, I prefer waiting a few days before doing the update.  But now it seem there is an update almost every week or so?At the moment, it shows update ledger live to 2.46.2 and that is just recently right?  There is no issue clicking download update on the top right corner since I already have ledger live downloaded a while back right since I had verified it already?  Anyone having issues with the balance not being correct?  Does clearing the cache always solve this issue?  Read on reddit not for everyone?

comments.author: n0nce
comments.body: Quote from: jerry0 on September 03, 2022, 07:45:22 PMAt the moment, it shows update ledger live to 2.46.2 and that is just recently right?  There is no issue clicking download update on the top right corner since I already have ledger live downloaded a while back right since I had verified it already?  Anyone having issues with the balance not being correct?  Does clearing the cache always solve this issue?  Read on reddit not for everyone?  You always need to verify (any of) your downloads. Every single version you have to verify hash and PGP signature.As for not updating; typically, the easiest and best thing for users to do in terms of improving their security, is to have everything up to date at all times. That's OS, packages, libraries, everything.Worst-case, you can always downgrade / download an older release or wait a few days for a bugfix.I have no experiences with Ledger live and would always recommend Bitcoin Core, Electrum or Sparrow, instead. Most hardware wallets do work with these, as well.

comments.author: jerry0
comments.body: Few people mentioned a while back, as long as you verified ledger live the first time you installed it on your windows computer, that is enough.  Any future updates you do when clicking on download updates after opening ledger live is safe.  That is still true though right?Okay but how long should one wait once ledger live has an update?  The latest update seem to be 2.46.2 and that was just recent.  So if I wait a few days, there might be a 2.46.3.  So how long do you wait till other users say okay no issue with it and then you download it?Also there is no issue at all continuing to use ledger live whether sending or receiving coins while using an older ledger live correct?  I didn't update ledger live since 2.42.0 because almost every single update after this, I heard people said there were issues with the balance not displaying correctly.  So is this one correct?

comments.author: n0nce
comments.body: Quote from: jerry0 on September 04, 2022, 12:18:21 AMFew people mentioned a while back, as long as you verified ledger live the first time you installed it on your windows computer, that is enough.  Any future updates you do when clicking on download updates after opening ledger live is safe.  That is still true though right?It's possible that Ledger Live automatically downloads and verifies the updates, yes. Can't verify as I don't use it.Quote from: jerry0 on September 04, 2022, 12:18:21 AMOkay but how long should one wait once ledger live has an update?  The latest update seem to be 2.46.2 and that was just recent.  So if I wait a few days, there might be a 2.46.3.  So how long do you wait till other users say okay no issue with it and then you download it?Any software, you should update as soon as the update drops. That's what they're for. They are tested before release to the public (if the company writing the software has any competence, that is). Nobody (serious) tests in production.Quote from: jerry0 on September 04, 2022, 12:18:21 AMAlso there is no issue at all continuing to use ledger live whether sending or receiving coins while using an older ledger live correct?  I didn't update ledger live since 2.42.0 because almost every single update after this, I heard people said there were issues with the balance not displaying correctly.  So is this one correct?I can't say for sure, but try it out - if it works, it works, right. Don't see a reason why it should stop working; I'd be mostly concerned about security issues, but you can also just read release notes to know exactly what the versions 2.42+ have added.Here's a page with the releases and their release notes:https://github.com/LedgerHQ/ledger-live/releases

comments.author: jerry0
comments.body: Thanks for the response.  Well i thought when there is any ledger update but especially firmware updates, it's best to wait few days first to see if there are issues with it mentioned by others first before you update?

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: jerry0 on September 05, 2022, 04:39:51 AMThanks for the response.  Well i thought when there is any ledger update but especially firmware updates, it's best to wait few days first to see if there are issues with it mentioned by others first before you update?I use ledger live software.I always keep it update  as any other software.  Just like n0nce said, it is safer and better to update as soon as it is released. There are no issues with balances now. And if you see any issue with balance, just delete the cache and it will work again.No reason to use an outdated software, and waiting a few days is useless.  You will see another update again, as ledger launches a new version every few days.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Quote from: jerry0 on September 04, 2022, 12:18:21 AMI heard people said there were issues with the balance not displaying correctly.  So is this one correct?  Yeah there are some instances[1], however you can just clear the application's cache or simply connect yout Ledger device to Electrum for you to verify the real balance in your wallet.[1] https://www.reddit.com/r/ledgerwallet/comments/x5xk5m/ledger_live_account_balance_error/Quote from: jerry0 on September 05, 2022, 04:39:51 AMit's best to wait few days first to see if there are issues with it mentioned by others first before you update?I don't think it's a big deal. For me, as long as there is an update available not only for Ledger Live but for the firmware as well -- I immediately update. In fact, before updating them, I am always 2 weeks behind after their release as I am not frequently using it.

It's the first time I see someone mention that GitHub release page after the old one got abandoned back in May. I have been using this support documentation lately. Bookmarked, thanks! Quote from: jerry0 on September 04, 2022, 12:18:21 AMI heard people said there were issues with the balance not displaying correctly.  So is this one correct?
